title: Site
description: Comprehensive site management requirements including mapping, traceability, risk assessment, food defense, exterior maintenance, equipment storage, waste management, and contamination prevention

requirements.text: Is there a map that accurately shows all aspects of the operation, including water sources and fixtures used to deliver water used in the operation?
mandatoryStatements: Current site map exists showing all operational areas
Map shows all water sources used in the operation
Map shows water delivery fixtures and distribution points
Map is updated when changes occur to the operation
Map is sufficiently detailed to support traceability and investigations
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification that map accurately reflects current operation
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Update map within 30 days of any operational changes

requirements.text: Are growing areas adequately identified or coded to enable trace back and trace forward in the event of a recall?
mandatoryStatements: All growing areas have unique identifiers or codes
Identification system enables trace back to specific growing areas
Identification system enables trace forward from growing areas to harvested product
Identification is documented in records and on maps
System supports rapid recall execution
Field markings or signage clearly identify growing areas
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual trace exercise to verify growing area identification system effectiveness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly verification that all active growing areas are properly identified

requirements.text: Has a documented risk assessment been developed, covering potential hazards associated with the site location and growing process including the flow of materials and equipment?
mandatoryStatements: Risk assessment is documented
Assessment covers hazards associated with site location
Assessment covers hazards in the growing process
Flow of materials is analyzed for contamination risks
Flow of equipment is analyzed for contamination risks
Biological, chemical, and physical hazards are considered
Risk assessment is reviewed and updated annually or when changes occur
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of risk assessment for completeness and accuracy
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate risk assessment update when operational changes occur

requirements.text: Where the risk assessment identifies the need for control of any hazards, are these controls indicated in the assessment and implemented?
mandatoryStatements: All identified hazards requiring control are documented in the risk assessment
Specific control measures are defined for each identified hazard
Controls are implemented as specified in the assessment
Implementation of controls is verified
Controls are monitored for effectiveness
Control failures trigger corrective actions
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that identified controls are implemented and effective
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Ongoing monitoring of control measures per defined frequencies

requirements.text: Are the necessary food defense controls implemented in the operation?
mandatoryStatements: Food defense plan is documented
Vulnerable areas are identified
Access controls are implemented for critical areas
Visitor control procedures are in place
Personnel security measures are implemented
Storage areas for chemicals and materials are secured
Monitoring of food defense controls occurs regularly
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual food defense vulnerability assessment and control review
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification of access controls and security measures

requirements.text: Is the exterior area immediately outside the growing area, including roads, yards and parking areas, free of litter, weeds and standing water?
mandatoryStatements: Exterior areas are maintained free of litter
Weeds are controlled in exterior areas
Standing water is eliminated or controlled
Roads and yards are maintained in good condition
Parking areas do not create contamination risk to growing areas
Regular cleaning and maintenance schedule is followed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly inspection of exterior areas for housekeeping compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of exterior area conditions, immediate correction of issues

requirements.text: Are control measures being implemented for the outside storage of equipment, pallets, tires, etc. (i.e., out of the mud, stacked to prevent pest harborage, away from the growing area)?
mandatoryStatements: Equipment and materials stored outside are kept out of mud and standing water
Items are stacked or stored to prevent pest harborage
Storage areas are located away from growing areas to minimize contamination risk
Stored items are maintained in sanitary condition
Storage areas are organized and controlled
Regular inspection of storage areas occurs
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly inspection of outdoor storage areas
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly verification of proper storage practices

requirements.text: Are garbage receptacles and dumpsters kept covered or closed?
mandatoryStatements: All garbage receptacles are equipped with covers or lids
Dumpsters are kept closed when not in active use
Covers are used to prevent pest access and odors
Waste containers are maintained in sanitary condition
Waste removal occurs frequently enough to prevent overflow
Waste containers are located to minimize contamination risk
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of waste container condition and use
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that waste containers are properly covered

requirements.text: Where soil, substrates or fertilizer are stored or handled, are measures in place to ensure seepage and runoff is collected or diverted and does not reach growing areas, product, or any of the water sources? A ZERO POINT DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THE AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Storage areas for soil, substrates, and fertilizer are designed to contain seepage and runoff
Berms, containment systems, or diversion controls are in place
Runoff cannot reach growing areas
Runoff cannot reach product or water sources
Storage areas are located and managed to minimize contamination risk
Containment systems are inspected and maintained regularly
Drainage from storage areas is controlled and monitored
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly inspection of containment systems, verification during heavy rain events
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of storage area conditions, immediate action if seepage or runoff detected

requirements.text: Where there are fill stations for fuel, pesticides, or liquid fertilizer, is it evident that the condition, location and/or use is not a risk of contamination to the product, water sources, growing areas, equipment, packaging materials, etc.?
mandatoryStatements: Fill stations are located away from product, water sources, and growing areas
Fill stations have secondary containment to prevent spills from spreading
Fill station condition is maintained to prevent leaks
Filling procedures minimize spillage risk
Fill areas are designed to contain and clean up spills
Equipment and packaging materials are protected from contamination
Regular inspection and maintenance of fill stations occurs
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly inspection of fill stations for condition and contamination risk
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification of fill station condition, immediate cleanup of any spills

requirements.text: Has the operation eliminated or adequately controlled any potential sources of contamination (physical, chemical or biological) not covered by other more specific questions?
mandatoryStatements: All potential contamination sources have been identified
Controls are in place for physical contamination sources
Controls are in place for chemical contamination sources
Controls are in place for biological contamination sources
Controls are effective and monitored
Any additional site-specific hazards are addressed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual comprehensive review of all contamination sources and controls
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Ongoing monitoring per risk assessment and control plan

requirements.text: Is there no evidence of animal presence and/or animal activity (wild or domestic) in the audited area? If Total Conformance, go to 2.02.12.
mandatoryStatements: Regular inspections for animal presence are conducted
Evidence of animal activity (tracks, droppings, damage) triggers investigation
Controls to prevent animal access are implemented
Monitoring for animal presence occurs regularly
Any animal presence is documented and addressed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily inspection during harvest/handling activities, weekly inspection of growing areas
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily monitoring for signs of animal presence, immediate action if detected

requirements.text: Is there no evidence of any evidence of animal fecal matter in the audited area? A ZERO POINT (NON-CONFORMANCE) DOWNSCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THIS AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Daily pre-harvest inspection for animal fecal matter is conducted
Any animal fecal matter discovered triggers immediate response
Affected areas are not harvested until addressed per procedure
Buffer zones around contaminated areas are established
Corrective actions are documented
Root cause investigation is conducted
Preventive measures are enhanced
requirements.verificationExpectations: Pre-harvest inspection records reviewed daily, verification during audits
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily pre-harvest inspection, immediate escalation if animal fecal matter detected

requirements.text: Is there no evidence of human fecal matter in the audited area? ANY DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THE AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Daily inspection for human fecal matter is conducted
Adequate toilet facilities are provided and maintained
Workers are trained never to defecate in growing areas
Any human fecal matter discovered triggers immediate halt of operations in affected area
Product in affected area is not harvested
Extensive buffer zones are established
Incident is fully investigated and documented
Enhanced preventive measures are implemented
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily pre-harvest inspection, immediate escalation of any findings
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily monitoring, zero tolerance policy strictly enforced

requirements.text: Is there no evidence of infants and toddlers in the audited area?
mandatoryStatements: Policy prohibits infants and toddlers in production areas
Policy is communicated to all workers
Childcare facilities are provided away from production areas (if applicable)
Supervision ensures policy compliance
Visitors with children are briefed on restrictions
Any violations are immediately corrected
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily supervision during operations, periodic review of policy compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous supervision during work hours, immediate correction of violations

capaInject: If site map outdated: update map within 7 days
If growing areas not properly identified: implement identification system within 14 days, update all records
If risk assessment incomplete or controls not implemented: complete/update assessment within 30 days, implement all identified controls within 60 days
If food defense controls inadequate: conduct vulnerability assessment within 14 days, implement enhanced controls within 30 days
If exterior areas not maintained: immediate cleaning, establish regular maintenance schedule
If storage not properly controlled: immediate reorganization, implement ongoing controls
If waste containers not covered: immediate correction, establish daily verification

If seepage/runoff from soil/fertilizer storage reaches growing areas or water sources: immediate containment, halt affected operations, conduct impact assessment, implement enhanced containment within 30 days
If fill stations pose contamination risk: immediate correction of deficiencies, relocate if necessary
If animal presence detected: immediate investigation, implement enhanced exclusion measures within 7 days
If animal fecal matter found: immediate halt of harvest in affected area, establish buffer zone, do not harvest affected product, investigate and implement enhanced controls, audit fails

If human fecal matter found: immediate halt of all operations in affected area, do not harvest any product from area, conduct full investigation, implement extensive preventive measures, retrain all workers, audit fails
If infants/toddlers in production area: immediate removal, retrain responsible workers, enhance supervision
traceabilityInject: Site map must trace all water sources to distribution points
Growing area identification must enable trace back and trace forward for recall purposes
Risk assessment must be traceable to specific hazards, controls, and implementation dates
Food defense controls must be traceable to specific vulnerable points and mitigation measures
Inspection records must be traceable to specific inspection dates, areas, and findings
